TopicTitle: New to KSP, what is the use of mechjeb?

Articles.Content: I have heard of Mechjeb and found of its robotic control on space ships. With KSP in such early development, why take out half the fun of the game (the other half is building the ship)?

Welcome to the community Nitehawk

MechJeb is just an add-on, and is not, and most likely will not become, a part of the KSP base game.

Some people like to use it, others not, and others like to learn from Mechjeb how to attain orbit and such before attempting it themselves.

By all means, use it or refrain from doing so, whichever is your preference, there is no need to install it if you do not want to, I myself prefer to fly all my craft by hand, without even the benefit of the ASAS

Well without mechjeb I would still be in kerbin atmosphere trying to get a good orbit. After playing around with mechjeb I learned how to build space worthy rockets and how to get a good orbit.

And I would not say it takes away half the fun, it more likely adds some instead, It can be harder to use mechjeb than controlling manually if you build a bad rocket... I almost always use mechjeb these days.

By the way, welcome to KSP! ^^
To add to UtterN's comment, MechJeb cannot put a rocket in space that isn't capable of orbiting without MechJeb, you still need to design a decent craft
As a software engineer, I'd expect to be more proficient at writing autom8 scripts than flying a rocket with a keyboard, and to be honest, it sounds like more fun

Some people just have different play styles. MechJeb allows people that don't want to deal with the manual flying of a rocket to enjoy the game.

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

Personally I don't use the autopilots, but the info it gives you is astounding. I can see my orbits inclination, true altitude when landing on the Mun. It's pretty useful to know I am 1000m above the surface, rather than 3000m above sea level. Welcome to the forums!
